Title: Leveraging accountability: How freedom of information brought courts into governance in Japan
Abstract: Political entrepreneurs promoted freedom of information ( jōhō kōkai ) ordinances at the local level in Japan beginning in 1980, and these statutes had become widespread by 1990 because of their popularity with voters, even though politicians had little information about how courts would interpret the ordinances. By 1995, Japanese courts had overruled many local government decisions to withhold information and had established a substantial body of precedent favorable to plaintiffs. Favorable court decisions, in turn, led to a mobilization of groups committed to using litigation and a sudden increase in freedom of information and taxpayer litigation in the late 1990s. Courts and court-like procedures have become increasingly important checks on democratic governments over the past 40 years. Japan should logically resist this trend toward “judicialization” because of its centralized, bureaucratic judiciary; its cohesive, autonomous bureaucracy; and longstanding single party rule. But in certain areas Japan has judicialized. Explanations of judicial intervention in governing have focused on political officials' need to control more powerful bureaucracies, litigation-based social movements' attempts to achieve policy goals, and increasing global flows of goods and knowledge as forces for convergence to a more legalistic mode of state-society relations. In Japan, however, administrative law specialists, not political officials, designed procedural statutes such as the Information Disclosure Act and Administrative Procedure Act. Court intervention has been the result not of a top-down concern for control but rather of a bottom-up campaign to use courts to hold government accountable. Through freedom of information and taxpayer litigation, courts have constrained government and redefined the mode of resolving state-society conflict. In administrative procedure, by contrast, courts and formal procedures initially promised to play similar roles but have failed to do so. Lower barriers to potential litigants under information disclosure and taxpayer suit statutes provided an opportunity for court intervention in governance. Nevertheless, the key reason for the different role of courts is that freedom of information and taxpayer suits enjoyed a network of interest groups willing and able to litigate, while few businesses were willing to pursue administrative procedure claims in court.

Title: Gender, space, and power: A cross -cultural perspective
Abstract: This research is a journey through the subjective experiences of men and women in low-income households in three cities across the world: Phoenix, London, and New Delhi. It examines the gendered nature of spaces in their housing, how this is understood differently in different cultures, and, hence, interpreted as “masculine” or “feminine.” It examines the feelings of belonging that are rooted to real or imaginary places, and how this is related to identity formations of particular social groups. Through the personal narratives and experiences of the urban poor in these three cities, this research examines concepts of spatial segregation, representational spaces, human agency, and the production of geographic inequalities. It thus deconstructs generalized sociospatial theories and practices and highlights their complexity by presupposing a different “politics of location” in which to articulate resistance. The ethnographic studies of public housing in these three cities find that safety and crime are the prime concerns of women everywhere. Yet, space is perceived differently from different gender, age, race, and ethnic positions. In all three cities, spatial narratives and practices construct powerful ideologies through which masculinity and femininity are understood. The architects and planners along with the local authorities are also involved in an image-making process, where the poor are housed behind middle-class facades to remove the very signs of poverty. Yet, there were both subtle and obvious expressions of human agency in all three cities, where users reorganized space to suit their values, beliefs, identities, and ideologies. From local narratives, the research moves to a more global analysis of discourses on economic growth, sustainable communities, and regeneration of neighborhoods. It indicates how spatial practices and the environmentalist and feminist movements have been hijacked for capital accumulation. It discusses how nation-states, local authorities, planners, policy makers, and architects use claims to objectivity and moral order to valorize certain social groups while condemning others. As seen in this research, it is always the poor, the marginalized, and the “others” who pay the price in the production of space for economic gains.

Title: Citizens or workers? The politics of *education in northeast Brazil, 1959–1964
Abstract: This dissertation analyzes and compares four educational reform projects implemented in the Northeast Brazilian state of Pernambuco during the short tumultuous period of popular coalition government immediately preceding the military coup of 1964. Case studies include the Movimento de Cultura Popular (MCP), sponsored by the populist municipal government of Recife; the Promoção Agnes, a program jointly run by a local missionary school and the Pernambuco state government; the Superintendência do Desenvolvimento do Nordeste (SUDENE), the federal government's regional development agency; and the United States Agency for International Development (USAID). With varying degrees of sincerity, these projects aimed to make good on the federal government's pledge of universal access to education, a right enshrined in the nation's constitution since 1824. This was no easy task. In 1959 there were 80,000 children between the ages of 7 and 14 in Recife that were without access to schooling and adult illiteracy was estimated to be 70 percent. Integral to each of these reform initiatives was a particular conception of what role education should play in the ordering of the social, economic and political reality. These conceptions are made evident in their founding charters, guiding plans and literacy books. Most importantly, these conceptions reflect larger trends and as such can help us to understand how these competing models of development interacted in other arenas as well. In this period Brazil's political and economic leadership was forced to choose between two contending models for how Brazil, and specifically the Northeast, should proceed, in terms of political and economic organization. Therefore, I address whether these education movements were primarily concerned with raising the popular sector's critical consciousness to create active citizens ( education for citizenship ), producing modern laborers for the emerging industrial sector ( education for development ), or simply appeasing the popular classes in order to maintain the status quo ( literacy for the status quo ). The underlying premise of the dissertation is the suggestion that through the lens of these educational reform initiatives we can expand our understanding of both the politics of development and the crisis of the populist state in 1950s and 1960s Northeast Brazil.

Title: An <i>ecologia-humana</i>-based historical inquiry as a creative force for nation building: Toward an appreciative model of conversational co-creation of a nation's future
Abstract: This dissertation is about the role of language as a means and a tool: to grasp knowledge and understanding from history, to draw from it notions of possibilities, and to generate the formation of an image of a nation's future. The idea of conversational co-creation of a nation's future emerged from a historical inquiry through a human ecology perspective. This perspective explains population movement in relationship to a social role based on geography, current knowledge, available technology, and the human agency perceptions. (For instance, the geographical key function of bridging two bodies of water via the Panama Canal.) This perspective also provides reasons for population migration and crowding within a country, allowing the possibility of choice about future population distribution. Using Panama as a case study and based on an understanding of its history, it is possible to comprehend that Panama is at an age of paradigm shift and it is possible to understand what it means to have the leadership defined by the ‘law of the situation.’ This leadership will be driven by the collective image, will be responded to through the collective behavior, will provide a reason to exist at a society level, and will serve as the motivation to make the decisions that need to be made. It is through a conversational process in a group, that learning what it means to be Panamanian takes place and the awareness of what the role of Panama is at a global level is awakened. Conversations, with this ecologically defined historical framework, generate the image and are the basis for action since society is communication. The co-creation of the image itself forms the national identity, produces a sense of belonging and provides a purpose that transcends—all of these with and through language. The combined ecological understanding coming out of the collective space process, equips leaders with the needed knowledge to develop new ideas and the motivation to carry out present actions that will transform into reality what started as a common vision. The case study includes an analysis of what is communicated through themes at a society level.

Title: Latino music, identity, and ethnicity: Two case studies
Abstract: This dissertation concerns itself with the construction and examination of a “Latino” musical and ethnic identity in two ethnographic case studies for which fieldwork was conducted in Berkeley, California (September 2000–February 2001) and New York City (June 2001–February 2002). In the first case study of Berkeley-based Chilean musician, composer and exile Quique Cruz, I examine the construction of his identity along ethnic Chilean lines and emphasize the continuity of Quique's musical identity in exile and diaspora. By placing Quique within historical and musical/artistic contexts, I demonstrate his connection to specific critical moments, people, and institutions in Chilean history. I posit his musical life history as a “cultural document” that extends beyond the idiosyncratically personal to illuminate aspects of the relationship between the individual and culture. I conclude the first case study with an analysis of The Archeology of Memory: Dreaming; Darkness and the Body; After the Fire…Water (TAOM), a work based on Cruz's experience of imprisonment and torture in the Chilean military's concentration camps during the 1970s. TAOM centrally concerns itself with the relationship between art and terror. The second case study focuses on El Taller Latino Americano, a community arts center in New York City's Upper West Side. I examine the strategic and fluctuating use of a pan-ethnic, hybrid conception of “Latino” by the taller's musical community during a season of concert performances and recordings. Also, I position El Taller Latino Americano as a “social movement” in the manner described by sociologist Agustín Laó-Montes, thus placing the cultural work and existence of the taller in a larger world-historical context with New York City as the site and body of the global. I conclude the second case study with the consideration of one of the taller's “regulars,” the renowned Peruvian guitarist Carlos Hayre, an important figure in Peruvian criollo and Afro-Peruvian folkloric music. I use the genre of the marinera limeña , the national dance of Peru, to discuss its close relationship to the Chilean cueca in the New York context of Hayre's musical activities.

Title: The Analysis of Chinese Mass Culture
Abstract: Mass Culture, which has another name called popular culture or populace culture, is a social culture phenomenon appearing in the process of urbanization and industrialization, and a tendency to develop culture directly being associated with Consumer Society. As forming the factor intricately, the range in the ascendant, popular of development trend involves the global new-type culture form, mass culture has already caused the extensive concern of Chinese and foreign scholars, The studying about it has already been launched in different disciplines, research of different angles and different aspects. Though the academia does not have a final conclusion to the essential intension of mass culture, yet at present there are different judgments on its social functions, and opinions vary to its development prospects. But, urgent need and historical mission of the socialist spiritual civilization developed on the basis of Chinese nation's advanced culture, there are positive theory and practice meanings in the analysis of the mass culture phenomenon to the contemporary Chinese society. In the western society, mass culture is not merely regarded as a kind of cultural life style dominated by culture industry, controlled for the commercial profit by cultural industry, and is often considered to be the cultural activity form set against with elite's culture and elegance culture. The western scholars hold the attitude of a kind of criticism to mass culture generally, among them regard criticism of the school of Frankfort as representatives particularly. The so-called " mass culture " of school of Frankfort, is the mass culture in the passive meaning, mainly refers in particular to depend on mass media technology, depend on living of the family and leisure, " culture mixed sweetmeat " that agitated the appreciation of art, politics , religious propaganda , philosophy idea and commercial profit , it is the mixtures of science and technology , economic base , ideology and cultural consumption, it is the important component or displaying the way in a totally new way of the modern capitalist commodity system. It has a partiality for the way concept and psychology of handling the masses of amusement with the leisure, cultivates and supports the consciousness of submitting to which rules, safeguards the current situation. Must is it say Frankfort society of school criticize theory point to the contemporary capitalist society mainly to come, it is a kind of culture to the developed industrial society in the west that is explained and criticized with culture. Undoubtedly, this kind of criticism is extremely deep, for us ,have reference function on analyzing contemporary Chinese mass culture scientifically. There are essential differences between Chinese mass culture and western mass culture. Chinese mass culture is after reform and opening-up, with the overall transition of the social structure of our country and brand-new culture phenomenon appearing in sound development of market economy, have extremely deep traditional culture inside information and extremely clear advanced cultural direction at the same time. According to Chinese great mission and essential request that Chinese culture develop of revival of nationhood, Chinese mass culture should be participated in and accepted voluntarily actively by most members of society of our country, have national characters ,accord with spirit of the times , rich science intension , for masses' culture life design loved by all, it must have a national characteristic , scientific and three major characteristics of popularization concurrently at the same time , must reflect it under the socialist market economy condition accurately , the practical experience of life and realizing in life of most members of Chinese society, meet the various demands for the culture life of the people to the greatest extent, and play a positive role to political democracy , economic development and culture prosperity of our country finally. But on the other hand, because contemporary mass culture of China begin to be right away influenced by western mass culture colonialism to sprout, in addition, of our country social cultural dynamics of member is it improve to demand urgently, advanced development and construction of the spiritual civilization of culture also face a series of problems and challenges, so, some unhealthy symptoms and troubling situation have appeared in contemporary Chinese mass culture, live a great deal of field take place passive negative function already , can't adopt a casual attitude already to potential harmfulness its in society, can't act with undue haste. Chinese mass culture, has already inherited Chinese nation's outstanding cultural tradition , infected with the bad habits and acquired characteristics of western mass culture too, thus make the behavior characteristic of Chinese mass culture have dual natures. On one hand, Chinese mass culture has front characteristics , such as national characteristic , science and popularization ,etc., on the other hand, negative characteristics , such as commerciality , level and homogeneity with western mass culture too ,etc., demonstrate a kind of mixing and contradiction on the whole. This text passes the folk culture to the ancient times with appearing in history of people's culture, the new culture of period of the May Fourth Movement , citizen of old Shanghai of 1930s culture, and the comparing vertically of culture form, such as revolutionary popular Volkswagen literature and art,etc. before and after founding the state, have announced that they are in the popular and masses inherent consistency of culture, reveal them in nature and enormous difference functionally too at the same time . Through compare to people's culture and national ideology culture , crosswise of culture , elite of intellectual, have announced the independent character of people's culture development. Elites of people's culture, national ideology culture, intellectual culture, they are as three kinds of different culture forms existing extensively in the present society of our country, have represented three kinds of different meanings and pointed to the cultural function different from three kinds separately, complement each other, restrict each other between the three, form whole pattern of socialist culture of our country together. Chinese mass culture is regarded as a whole important component of culture with Chinese characteristics, itself including national , scientific , mass value pursue , have positive social functions inside, play a positive role to political democracy , economic development and culture prosperity of our country; But at the same time , because receive the western adverse effect of colonizing the effect of mass culture, in addition, the cultural dynamics of social members of our country is limited, thus aggravated the negative effects in social life of Chinese mass culture ,either. In general terms, the social function of contemporary Chinese mass culture demonstrates the contradiction characteristic conflicting each other ,too: In economic field, Chinese mass culture encouraged the Mormonism behavior while bringing about an advance in productivity; In the political field, Chinese mass culture clears up national ideology too while promoting national democratic politics construction; In the field of culture, It has also connived at cultural hegemony while promoting culture to share . Setting up the mass culture with Chinese characteristics, must adhere to three major principles: That is nationality, scientific and popularization. So-called national characteristic, it is development of culture that should inherit and develop Chinese nation outstanding cultural tradition and revolutionary cultural tradition, make great efforts to reflect modern life styles of the people, modern mode of thinking, modern behavior standard , modern morals sentiment , modern aesthetic temperament and interest , modern to conduct oneself in society attitude and modern prevailing custom; Meanwhile, culture should meet the needs of the world , put the cultural development of our country in great background of world culture development, absorb the outstanding cultural quintessence of the various nationalities in the world, with the independent open psychology , reject all its dresses unfavorable to the human development, learn wildly from other's strong points , is used by me. In short, keep not only keep one's own national characters but also and other national equal interchange of culture, realize absorbing each other, common development. What is called scientific, it is development of culture that must insist on scientific spirit that seek truth from facts, insist that the unifying of the theory and practice, will not merely develop rich and colorful philosophy social science and various kinds of literature and art, also should develop the educational culture and science and technology in a more cost-effective manner , with feudalistic superstition ,struggle pseudoscience and moribund ideology and culture firmly, remove culture rubbish constantly, one that is for society overall to offer assurance of ideology and culture while being progressive. What is called popularization, it is construction and development of culture that must regard vastest the people as starting point and home order, make culture become reflection that the people build great practice of socialist modernization, serve the people, educational people, enjoyed by the people conversely, thus make the people improve one's own thought cultural dynamics and level of science and culture constantly, become the new generation of people with lofty ideals, moral integrity, good education and a strong sense of discipline. Make great efforts to guide the positive factor of mass culture, criticize its negative factor in a more cost-effective manner, the ones that criticized built the rational form of future which constructs the mass culture of implicit national characteristic, scientific and popular characteristic, it is the great subject for research that Chinese mass culture puts forward to us. This text put forward criticize is it construct people's culture with Chinese characteristics get some countermeasures out of to build tentatively. Countermeasures these are it build constructing from macroscopic and microcosmic two level to China people's culture rationally to launch. On the microscopically level, mainly strengthen the humanity to mass culture of elite's culture to promote. We can say, all drawbacks of mass culture, its lies in the disappearance of humane spirit a bit more thoroughly. Dispel all sorts of drawbacks of people's culture, set up the healthy and progressive people's culture with Chinese characteristics, must inject humane spirit into people's culture. Humane spirit human reason appearing in value, to assemble on whole human inherent soul of culture life, it regards pursuing to the lofty value ideal of truth, good and beauty as the core, regards people's own development in an all-round way as the ultimate purpose. Practice has proved carry on humane promotion of spirit to people's culture, to dispel people's culture effective way of drawback. On the micro level, rely on national guide and concrete legal norm and various kinds of cultural policies that country make of ideology strengthen the production to people's culture mainly, circulation, consume all basin manage and standardize. Through promote government norm in microcosmic to humanity of macroscopic, people's culture of China ,, dispel its negative factor as much as possible , really builds and constructs meeting most social member's culture life's needs and people's culture with Chinese characteristics, it will be a great social subject that will be showing especially constantly in field of practice and theory . This text just elementary to get several countermeasure out of, the social subject await further promotion research.

Title: A Study of Western Ecocriticism
Abstract: Ecocriticism is the product of literary studies and the contemporary ecological thought, the greening of literary studies, and the comprehensive responses to the present global ecological crisis. It is an immensely complex and open system of literary criticism with the characteristics of both literary criticism and cultural criticism. Ecocriticism might succinctly be defined as study of the relation between literature and physical environment conducted in a spirit of commitment to environment praxis. It takes an earth-centered approach to literary studies, and expands the notion of anthropocentric literary studies to include the entire ecosphere. All ecological criticism, based on holism and inter-relatedness of ecophilosophy, shares the premise that both human culture and human society are connected to physical world, affecting it and affected by it. Ecocriticism convincingly reveals that the ecological crisis in nature is the crisis of human civilization, human nature and imagination. Therefore, more science and more technology are not going to get us out of the present ecological crisis until we conscientiously involve the humanities and the social sciences in guiding them and solving ecological crisis in a big way. To root out the ecological crisis, we must go out of vicious circle of anthropocentrism, and dismantle the barriers between the modern sciences based on the mechanistic-reductionist character and Cartesian dualism. So ecocritics take the inter-disciplinary and cross-cultural, even cross-civilization approach to track down the fundamental causes of ecological crisis, and explore the effective strategies to cope with the ecological crisis. Both “interdisciplinarity” and “cross-culturality” are the two most distinct features of ecocriticism. Ecocriticism as a distinct critical school or movement originated in the United States of America, and is the product of the complicated social, academic and philosophical context. The direct cause of its birth is the increasingly deteriorating contemporary ecological crisis, the academic background of its birth the reaction to the contemporary literary criticism retreating from realistic ecological crisis, and the theoretical foundation of its birth the developing ecophilosophy. The dissertation consists of three parts. Its first part, that is, its first chapter, gives an overview of the social, academic and philosophical background of ecocriticism, its development, and its main contents as well as its theoretical foundation. It also points out the objective necessity that the anthropocentric paradigm must be replaced by ecocentric paradigm. Its second part can be divided into four chapters (chapter two, chapter three, chapter four and chapter five), and chiefly gives a systematic and profound study of the contents of Western ecocriticism. Chapter two focuses on the cultural criticism dimension in Western ecocriticism, and diagnoses the historical and cultural causes of the ecological crisis in a comprehensive and profound way. It points out that in the final analysis the ecological crisis is a crisis of Western culture, a crisis of human domination of nature, a crisis of developmental patterns, a crisis of social institutions as well as a crisis of human life-styles. Thus, ecocritics expose the nature of anthropocentrism and subvert it from interdisciplinary perspective. Lynn White opens up the cultural criticism dimension by criticizing anthropocentrism inherent in Christianity. Western Renaissance and Enlightenment humanism elevates man to the sole speaking subject and rational sovereign of natural order by overemphasizing human “reason”. Since then, voluble nature has become not only a mute object, but also a conquered, dominated and raped object. Modern Western science and technology pervaded by anthropocentrism further intensifies and expands man’s domination of nature. The picturesque aesthetic strengthens man’s domination in the name of natural beauty. In short, ecocentric philosophy constitutes a serious challenge to anthropocentrism. Its idea of holism and relatedness urges that on the one hand we must dig the ecological wisdom out of cultural traditions and bring out the inseparable kindredship between man and nature, on the other we must diagnose the complex cultural causes of the ecological crisis, so as to reform and green human cultures. Chapter three is about ecocritical reading of literary ecology, and its purpose is to eliminate the anti-ecological elements in it according to the ecological yardstick. First of all, the ecocritics attack the contemporary literary theories that repel and banish nature. Then the ecocritics also deconstruct and subvert the literary classics, even rewrite them. In the meantime, the ecocritics also try to expand and deepen the field of ecocriticism by integrating itself with other literary theories and drawing on a variety of theories, such as feminist, Marxist, poststructuralist theories. For example, ecofeminist literary theory sees the important connections between the domination of women and the domination of nonhuman nature, and both are the result of an oppressive patriarchal conceptual framework. Thus it opens up a new dimension of ecocriticism. Chapter four focuses on the regular forms of literary ecocentrism. Literary ecocentrism rejects the anthropocentric literary vision, and regards natural world, including man, as the subject of literary representation. Human subjects are only a species of natural world, and nature is far more than the stage of “the little human morality play”, the resources to be consumed, and the objects to be conquered. In the chapter the author first deals with the “aesthetics of relinquishment”, that is, giving up conquering and possessing nature, even giving up individual autonomy, centrality and the illusion of mental and even bodily apartness from one’s environment. Then the author switches to the ascription of subjectiveness to the nonhuman world. The nonhuman world entities such as the framework of seasons, the place, the animals and plants become the subjects of literary representation. What’s more, the author will study the writing of environmental apocalypticism. The ecological writers create master metaphors of ecocatastrophe to inspire man’s ecological conscience and cultivate man’s ecological sensibility so as to avert doom. Chapter five is concerned with the cross-cultural expansion of ecocriticism. The cultural diversity is the physical manifestations of ecological diversity, and ecological multiculturality urges that ecocriticism must explore the complexity of ecological issues and corresponding strategies from cross-cultural, even cross-civilization perspective. Ecocriticism rejects globalism and cultural hegemony that replace and devour the local knowledge and indigenous cultures, and calls for ecological democracy and cross-cultural ecological dialogues. Third part, that is, the last chapter of the dissertation, chapter six, gives a brief survey of the rise, development and present situation of Chinese ecocriticism (Chinese mainland). The author also points out its shortcomings from his own view, that is, both its awareness of comparative literature as discipline and its sense of theoretical building up are thin. The main academic values of the dissertation could be summarized as follows: 1. The result of the research is the first PhD dissertation in Chinese mainland, which deals with Western ecocriticism in a comprehensive and profound way, so it is a pioneer job. After having read a number of Western ecocritical classics, the author gives a systematic survey of Western ecotheory. In the meantime, the author also clearly defines the boundaries of Western ecocriticism, and its main features in general terms, and point out that both interdisciplinarity and cross-culturality are its two distinct features pervasive throughout the ecocritical academic activities. 2. Western ecocriticism has developed a comprehensive and open ecotheory with a solid ecophilosophical foundation, wide academic vision and rich academic practices, whereas Chinese ecocriticism is just in its infancy, with thin awareness of comparative literature as a discipline and theoretical building up at the initial stage. In the mean time, Chinese ecocritics have a very limited knowledge of Western ecocriticism. So the dissertation is of vital significance to Chinese ecocritical circle. What’s more, what the author used in the thesis is almost first-hand latest original materials. To have a comprehensive grasp of Western ecocriticism, the author collected a large number of ecocritical classics and related materials from England and America. Until now, the mainland China’s libraries have no these books or publications quoted in the dissertation, let alone their Chinese translation. Many ecocritical terms have been for the first time introduced into Chinese ecocritical circle by the author. So the dissertation could for sure contribute to having a good command of the development of Western ecocriticism, promote the communication and dialogue on ecological issues between China and the West, enhance the ecological vision and ecological thinking of Chinese ecocritics, and expand their academic vision. 3. The dissertation could make great contribution to promoting the development of comparative literature of China and expanding the field of its research. Ecocriticism may shift the foundation of thought of comparative literature from anthropocentrism to ecocentrism. The interdisciplinary and cross-cultural features of ecocriticism will open up new academic dimension of comparative literature, promote its greening tendency, and involve itself in the global ecological academic movement. Its interdisciplinary and cross-cultural studies are to promote not only the communication, the exchanges and the understanding between peoples, nations, and cultures, but also the reconciliation and harmony between man and nature; not only to eliminate the racism, cultural hegemony, but also to eradicate speciesism and species hegemony. If so, the existence of the Eurocentrism of comparative literature, cultural hegemonism, cultural isolationism as well as all the other isms based on prejudices, alienation, enmity and self-centeredness is unfounded, because they run counter not only to human cultures but also to ecological democracy. Both the interdisciplinary and cross-cultural features of ecocriticism expand the field of comparative literature to include the entire ecosphere. To sum up, the dissertation can promote the progress of ecocriticism in Chinese mainland, the construction of Chinese ecological discourse as well as the dialogue on ecological issues between China and the West for sure. In the meantime, it can contribute to the greening of comparative literature studies and expand further its field of research.

Title: On Public Capital
Abstract: The public capital is the capitalization of public assets, the organic unification of the public-owned content and capital form, the key to understand that the socialist basic system combines with market economic system, and the key and peculiar category of the socialist market economy. It only contacts the certain historical stage especially the primary stage of socialism, produces with formulation of socialist market economy, develops but develops, and withers away as it withers away. As the general form of value, the public capital is a kind of factor of production in conformity with large-scale social production, playing an irreplaceable role to the productivity development of the primary stage of socialism; And as the special form of value, the public capital reflect the double social relationships of " the labor engages the capital and the capital engages the labor " under the socialist market economy condition , it is " cube barranca of Kraft " that must be crossed in the socialist development process. This text divides six chapters altogether. Chapter one: the introduction, mainly introduces the reason, current situation, method and frame of the public capital studying, and has defined the public capital category. Understanding the public capital in the historical process of socialism movement, regarding the emergence, development of the public capital as the basic clue, finding the basic law of socialist market economic development, thus undertaking the historical mission of the theory worker of Marxism, it is our main reason of studying public capital. But as the speech of current situation of the studying on the public capital, the energy that the academia invests is far unbecoming to compare with the status of public capital as key category of socialist market economy. Studying the public capital, just as studying other social relationships, there is an academic position question, this is unavoidable as for researcher. We stand at Marxism position, use Marxist history and logic unified method and contradiction analytic approach study the public capital mainly; At the same time in order to avoid causing it through the dispute of the institute type as much as possible, used the analytic approach of the real example in a large amount too. Using these methods, we have investigated the public capital category, have analyzed the forming, producing, circulating, distributing, running and managing of the public capital, and sum up and analyze its contradiction on the basis of summarizing these practices, then analyze the development trend of the public capital further according to the public capital contradiction. This is basic train of thought and frame of this text. Coming to define in terms of its content, form and history regulation, the public capital is the capitalizing of public assets, it is the unifying organically of the public-owned content and capital form, it is the value that can bring surplus value to the socialist state and collective. It is the key category and peculiar category of the socialist market economy, only contacts the certain historical stage especially the primary stage of socialism, produces with formulation of socialist market economy, develops but develops, and withers away as it withers away . Chapter two: The forming of the public capital. Mainly research socialized gradual progress of the private capital and production of the public capital in the socialist state. Investigating the socialist movement from fact and the public capital in the historical process of socialist movement, we find two roads run parallel with: The socialization of private capital in developed capitalist nations and the production of public capital in socialist states whose economy and culture are relatively backward. Outwardly it seems that the two take their own roads, irrelevant at all, but they closely connect and influence each other in fact. As to historical order, formerly socializing of private capital in capitalist nations, producing of public capital in socialist state in after, the production of public capital walks abreast just with a certain stage of private capital socialization, and the socialization of private capital in developed capitalist nations form the background and external reason that public capital produce in socialist states of economy and culture relatively backward. Private capital, with the constant development of the large-scale social production, grow from ownership of the private capital to ownership of private share capital after going through one, and then reach the course of ownership of corporation share capital (namely corporation capital ownership ). The most obvious trend that this course embodies is the socialization day by day of the capital. And the final result of private capital socialization day by day must be “turning the capital into the public one which belongs to all social members' property”, “it will lose its class nature ". Public capital, the economic category which an author of a classic of Marxism had never involved, in the process of reform and opening-up of socialist state that economy and culture is relatively backward, under the background of fact that the private capital is socialized and the globalization process is accelerated day by day, arises at the historic moment as the setting-up of the socialist market economy system. Public capital, there is course of a primitive accumulation too. “Depriving depriver", namely the private capital leaving over old China was changed into the socialist state-owned property; Leading and transforming the self-employed laborer, namely carries on the transformation to agriculture and private industry and commerce; Implementing the high accumulation rate, namely carries on " depriving oneself " of the socialism type; Through " scissors difference", by mending the worker's industrial policy agriculturally, the value was shifted from the agricultural surplus labor. The way of these public capital primitive accumulation, though not like the capitalist primitive accumulation was " written into human annals with the characters of blood and fire " like that, adopt ultra compulsive means of economy too , accumulate conditions of " labor hires capital " and " capital hires labor " within shorter time, namely to form the “ prehistory ” of public capital. Chapter three: The production, circulation and distribution of the public capital. Mainly research the universal law and special law of the production, circulation and distribution of public capital, as well as how to perfect the system that the public capital is produced, circulated and distributed. The production and circulation of the public capital follows the universal law of the production and circulation of the capital, and there is its own particularity too at the same time. Decided by the production of public capital, the distribution of public capital adopts the double level of distribution under socialist market economy, namely the mode combined distributing in money and distributing according to work, of which the first grade is distribution in money, the second is distribution according to work. The law that the public capital was produced, circulated and distributed, has reflected the basic state of circuitous development of public ownership under socialist market economy. Public capital production is the unity of work course and value multiplication course. In this course, not only the use value of meeting working people's needs, but also the surplus value of public capital has been produced. This is the characteristic of public capital production. For this reason, public assets turn into the public capital, it is the prerequisite that public capital is produced; the workforce turns into the goods under the socialist market economy condition, it is the prerequisite that public assets turn into the public capital. As value production, the public capital production must follow the universal law that value is produced. To encourage the enterprises to compete in the market, to mould public-owned enterprises into a qualified market main body, to set up modern enterprise system, to adjust the state-run economic layout and development strategy on the whole, it is an inevitable request that value is produced. The public capital circulation follows the universal law that the capital circulates, such as the circulation law of the capital, the turnover law of the capital and the law of that the means of production have priority to increase; and it has its own particularity too at the same time. Because of the decision of double goal of production and management, public capital circulation is not regulated all by surplus law of value and law of value. To the disposition of public capital resources, the planned mechanism will be used frequently besides using the market mechanism. Because of the special position and function of the public capital in our national economy, the flow, circulation of the public capital will exert an important influence on macro-economy operation. So to perfect the public capital circulation system, we must combine universal law and special law that the public capital circulates, must adhere to the scrupulous attitude to advance and retreat and structural adjustment of the public capital. We should follow the universal law of market economy, should consider the will of the people and the national conditions too. The distribution of the public capital is in the leading position under the socialist market economy condition in general capital distribution. The general capital distribution means the total distribution pattern of the national income under the socialist market economy condition, namely the distribution pattern of the total surplus value of public capital and private capital and laborer’s salary, its essence is to handle the country, enterprise and individual interests well. The general capital distribution is rational basically in our country, and the incomes of the country, enterprise and resident are balanced on the whole. But a lot of question are exposed and happened too at the same time, especially such that financial support is heavily different under different industry, so that some industries can not get very good development for a long time. And that the wage level of different trade draws heavy, this cause the society to pay close attention to fair problem. As regards itself, the distribution of public capital means the interests partition among the country or the collective and laborer. Because the relations between public capital and labor are double employer-employee relationships under the socialist market economy condition, namely relations that " labor hiring capital-capital hiring labor ", so, the public capital distribution is divided into two levels accordingly: The first level is to assign according to the relation of " capital hires labor ", namely the country obtained public surplus value in the capacity of investor, worker obtained salary in the provider's identity with the workforce. Therefore, the distribution of the first level is the distribution that is determined by the market mechanism, paying attention to efficiency. The second level is to reallocate according to the relation of “labor hires capital ", the united laborer realizes its right that asks for surplus value in the capacity of final owner. So the distribution of the second level is carried on in the form of macro adjustments and controls by the country, laying particular emphasis on the justice. According to the current situation of the public capital distribution, the publicly-owned enterprise's overall wage level advances by leaps and bounds since reform and opening-up, but the out-of-balance question of the structure exists too, wages level difference of different trade, different area are all greater, the public capital should solve the inside fair problem too when being distributed. The problem existing in the field of public capital distribution will be solved effectively only through perfecting public capital distribution system constantly. This kind of distribution system has already been different from public assets under planned economic system to distribute, also different from capital distribution in the capitalist country. We should pay attention to efficiency through the function of the market mechanism, as well as pay attention to justice through strengthening government regulating function in income distribution. How to set up efficient and fair distribution system, it is the big problem that we still need to probe further in practice. Chapter four: the operation and management of the public capital. Mainly research how to run and manage the public capital according to its essence and law. The problems of public capital in the course of producing, circulating and distributing, show evidently as how to operate and manage public capital at present. Public capital operation is to operate it according to the law that the public capital moves, to make the use of the public capital give play to the greatest efficiency. The main form of the public capital operation is the state-run capital operation. As the main respect of the public capital operation, the state-run capital operation regard improving the utilization benefit of the state-run capital as object, regard market mechanism as the basic means. It is a kind of operational and managerial activities that on the basis of the separation of two rights of state-run capital, the country proceeds from whole state-run economic development strategy as the investor, enterprises proceed from their own development strategy as the microcosmic main body, the two go on scientific plan and effective operation at different levels. However, the public capital operation is at its initial stage yet, there are still a lot of questions in practice, such that the public-owned enterprises are not complete market main bodies, the non market-oriented factors still exist; The capital market development is not perfect yet; Ignore the production and management, put undue emphasis on the capital operation; The social security system is still imperfect, etc.. In order to solve the problem that exist in the public capital operation, make the public capital operation more efficient with benefit, the most key one is to set up and perfect the supervision and management system of the public capital. While using experience of management of the foreign state-run capital for reference, to summarize the successful management mode appearing in the state-owned economy evolution of our country actively, basic train of thought has been proposed by the 16th National Congress that "the central government and local government fulfils contributor’s duty on behalf of the country respectively ". According to this train of thought, the State Council passes through and issues "the provisional administrative regulations of the supervision of enterprise's state-run assets”, which indicates that the state-run economic reform of our country develops from the stage of the definition of property right and the exploration of property right mode to the management stage of the public capital. Certainly, the regulation is only “interim regulation", a lot of questions especially property right questions are still need to study and probe further in practice. Chapter five: public capital contradiction. Mainly research inherent contradiction, external contradiction and the rule of public capital development as well as the impact of the public capital contradiction on its production and running. The production, circulation, distribution, running and management of the public capital, is shown as circuitous advancement in practice, which is decided by the inherent contradiction of the public capital and limited by its external contradiction again at the same time. The inherent contradiction of the public capital is the contradiction of public-owned content and the capital form, and it stipulates the basic trend of the public capital development. The external contradiction of the public capital is the contradiction of public capital and private capital, and it plays a role in accelerating or delaying the development of the public capital. The expansion of the public capital inherent contradiction is its production, circulation, distribution, running and management, and the expansion of the public capital external contradiction is the concrete mode of the competition as well as cooperation between public capital and private capital. The inherent contradiction of public capital concentratedly embodies in the relation of a series of unity of opposites including non-exclusiveness and exclusiveness, social benefit and economic benefits, worker controlling the means of production and the means of production controlling worker, distribution according to work and distribution in money etc. Meanwhile, in two kinds of concrete forms of the public capital -- state-run capital and collective capital, the form of expression of these contradictions is different to some extent. The inherent contradiction of the public capital is having important influence on production and management of the public capital, because it is embodied in the contradiction of the ownership of the capital and the power of management in practice, namely the contradiction of who own the capital and who run the capital. This is exactly the key problem that we make sure progress but do not solved at all so far in our country socialist market economic development process. The external contradiction of the public capital includes two respects of belligerence and identity. As regards belligerence, it is the relation that the public capital and the private capital are distinguished and competed for, and there are obvious differences in the respects, such as the interests goal and way that the two are pursuing, the distribution method of surplus value and the relation of the two and working, and the capital accumulation way and trend, etc., at the same time the two are carrying on keen competition on the market as different interests main body. As to identity, it is the relation of interdependence, transfixion each other and transform each other between public capital and private capital, embodying in the cooperation on the market of two, such as participating in each other by shares, permeating each other, and the transformation of control power or the transformation of the capital form taking place when the condition is ripe. But the total trend is that the private capital turns into the public capital more and more, and in competing, the public capital studies experience of the private capital constantly, revises its own deficiency , thus improves and strengthens itself in the market competition rapidly, obtains more and more shareholding , and realizes the transition from expansion of quantity to qualitative leap finally, finishes this specific historical category of the public capital with revolutionary significance to deny itself, thus, the public ownership can be realized in more appropriate form on higher, more perfecting and riper level. Chapter six: the sublation of the private capital and expansion of the public capital. Mainly research the historical process of the self-sublation of private capital and the historical trend of the expansion of public capital. The two points to the same goal that socialism will replace capitalism finally through public capital replace private capital. The inexorable development trend of public capital contradiction is that the public capital denies the private capital and finally denies itself, and the private capital itself has a course self-denied. Development from the form of the private owner to the shareholding system form and then to the form of the state-run capital, has reflected the course that the private capital transforms from private capital to social capital with constant development of the large-scale social production. This transformation has relaxed the social contradiction of the capitalism, and has accumulated the condition for the new mode of production. However, it has not gone beyond the range of the private capital, so Marx calls this kind of transformation "the passive sublation". In the process of the self-sublation of the private capital, there has appeared in " worker's own cooperative factory " within the capitalist society, which can be regarded as a kind of economic form similar to the public capital, for it sublates the opposition between capital and labor, Marx calls this kind of sublation as "the active sublation". In the current international market, the position of the public capital is similar to that of the “cooperative factory" in the capitalist domestic market. Though the public capital is still very small and weak can be regarded as it “the first breach that old form is open in the old form ", there are far-reaching meanings. The expansion of capital is the natural instinct of it. The expansion of the private capital promotes the process of the economic globalization, which makes the capitalism grow from country's monopoly capitalism to international monopoly capitalism, and these form the international background that public capital monopolizes with the competition. Through summarizing the historical law of capital development, we can find that monopoly, despite the negative effect of suppressing the technological progress, is one chapter that must be written in the history of the capital. It is the centralized inevitable outcome of production, yet conversely promotes production to be centralized further again. It is the catalyst which makes capital socialized to form the extensive capital, and conversely the socialized capital often accumulates the condition that monopoly expands. Monopoly squeezes but does not eliminate the competition, the competition between the monopolies is larger, the degree is fiercer. The modes of the profit of monopoly are "ed leave metrically together" as monopoly develops till today, on the one hand it obtaining monopoly profits relying on its monopoly position, on the other hand speeding up technological development to keep its leading advantage in the trade. So, while seeing negative consequence monopolized at the present age, we should see its function as the social capital catalyst objectively too. The public capital must allow “rational monopoly”, the domestic monopoly facing the international monopoly capital, if the public capital wants to form the enterprises colony analogous to the scale of the capital to participate in the international competition. The purpose that we maintain the “rational monopoly” of public capital is to accelerate the speed of accumulation of the public capital, make it rank among the ranks of the transnational group quickly, as many as possible as much as possible. But the public capital has just come into being, and still in transforming, it also mainly lays particular emphasis on inside merger at present, so the strategy of implementing “walking out " will be a very long course. Even so, but paces that the public capital expands will not stop. The motive force that the public capital expands depends on the pursuit of publicly-owned surplus value and pressure of the market competition, yet the trend that the public capital expands depends on the development of inherent contradiction and external contradiction of the public capital. So, the dialectical movement course in practice of contradiction of the public capital is the historical course naturally of public capital accumulation, and the historical course that the public capital expands constantly as the ones that accumulate go on continuously. And with the development of contradiction movement of the public capital, the accumulation of the public capital will develop in the unity of twists and advancement too, and the public capital will demonstrate certain wave accordingly too in its expansion. And just in the course of such dialectical development, the public capital will sublate itself constantly, also sublate the private capital in the course of expansion of it at the same time, until finish its historical mission and exit from socialist stage of economic history.

Title: The Study on Financial Risk During Transitional Period And on Transferring of Fiscal Risk to Financial Risk
Abstract: Along with accelerating reforms of financial system and state-owned enterprises, financial risks have been drawing increasing attentions, especially since the Asian Financial Crisis of 1997. How to prevent and avert financial risks thus need to be investigated into. In order to control the financial risks or to tackle any financial crisis in China, it is necessary to clearly understand the systemic reasons, and internal and external factors that cause the financial risks. Theoretically, financial risks stem from limitation of sensibility and asymmetry of information, but the features of financial risks vary in different countries for specific reasons. There are quantities of papers on the common reasons for financial risks, but few on the financial risks in China during transitional period, especially on transferring of fiscal risk in China to financial risks. Having analyzed the special formation system of financial risks during the transitional period and the transferring of the fiscal risks, this thesis manages to explore the pre-warning system and strategy to prevent and avert financial risk during transitional period in China. The thesis consists of six chapters. It begins with reviewing of former theories on the financial risk and constructing of a new theory framework, which shall be the basis to further investigate. Then it systematically looks into the formation mechanism of financial risk from internal formation system and external transferring system. Having reviewed the pre-warning system in foreign countries and the transferring of fiscal risks in China to financial risks, it investigates both the internal and external factors that cause the financial risks during the transitional period in China. Finally, it comes up with suggestions on how to establish new type relations between fiscal system and financial system, and strategies to avert financial risks. Chapter One carries detailed analysis of Marxist and Western theories on financial risks after analysis of generic theories and reasons for formation of financial risks. According to the author, financial risks refer to the magnitude and probability of losses caused to the entity by uncertainty and fluctuation in the economic factors in the financial market under certain conditions and in certain periods. The magnitude and probability of losses are essential to reflect financial risks. Generally, the financial risks stem mainly from economic and social specialization, multiform of its derivative transactions, limited sensibility and opportunistic inclinations by economic participants, uncertainty of economic conditions, asymmetry of information, and financial system and its evolvement. Chapter Two systematically analyzes the formation of the financial risks mainly from financial system, economic structure, and opening economy. It argues that under the floating exchange rate system, there usually exists excessive fluctuation and mismatch in the exchange rates. The floating exchange rate system will speed up the internationalization of virtual capital, and then increase the uncertainty and risks of the financial markets. Then weakened control by monetary authority over the speculative capitals contributes to the fast growth and movement of speculative capitals and thus generates negative impacts on the world economy. However, under the highly integrated global financial system, the peg system will also have irresolvable internal conflicts. When the control over capital flows is loosened, the peg system will usually magnify the external impacts and thus make a currency crisis and the Domino Effect quite easy. Among those factors leading to financial crisis, actual economic and investment activities are always the main ones. It can be seen from the flaws and mistakes in economic and investment activities, financial risks caused by economic cyclical fluctuations and structural changes. Even the financial investment process that is more and more deeply affected by the formation process of financial risks is also subject to the actual economic and investment activities. In addition, modern information transmission and financial liberalization substantially accelerate fund moving in the global financial market. Investors, fund-suppliers, and markets in each country thus all merge into global financial market. Such a global capital moving, far beyond goods and merchandise, becomes one of most active factors in the current world economy, and then forcibly influences the allocation of international financial resources in the global range, and alternates each country’s economic efficiency, and increases the volatility and uncertainty of price signal, and supply and demand of financial transactions. Especially, a large scale of international short-term capital consequently imposes impact on the effectiveness of macro-economic policies of each government and on the micro-decision of each sort of economic entity. Chapter Three preliminarily explores the modality of establishment of financial risk pre-warning and prevention system in China based on empirical study of the foreign financial risk pre-warning and prevention system. The author argues that all macro-departments are inter-related and there exist causal relations among macro-economic indicators, and continuously worsened macro-economic indicators always come first before financial crisis. A pre-warning system can inform people of an impending financial crisis and help the people to avert it. History teaches people that it is urgent and necessary to set up a system to monitor the financial risks. In reality, it is very difficult to analyze and forecast financial risks and crises. Such a comprehensive analysis on different types of financial risks is imperative. It is difficult to classify a financial crisis into a certain category, but a big financial crisis always comes after an unbalanced economy that contains a certain kind of financial risk. Therefore, pre-warning should start from pre-warning on the initial financial risks, which is significant in preventing the outbreak of financial crises. Chapter Four systematically analyzes both the internal and external factors causing the financial crisis during the transitional period in China respectively from the structural factors, market factors and international factors. The purpose to study the financial crisis in China is to get to know the features of financial risks in China and to prevent the financial safety in China from the accumulation of financial risks. The author believes that there exist diversity and controllability of financial risks in a market economy while concentration and invisibility in the planning system. Then accumulation and acceleration will feature the financial risks during the transitional periods in China. At present, China is transforming from planning system to market economy; both old and new systems coexist. On the one hand, old system is still functioning in many areas of the social economy, blocking the setup and operating of the new system. On the other hand, the new system originating from the old system is still imperfect and can not yet effectively regulate and adjust its own operations. As a result, the new system has to resort to the old system. Under the current special circumstances the financial risks in China not only carries the generic risks in the market economy and traditional risks during the early stages of financial market but also are featured as systemic risks during the transitional period in China. The author has indicated that financial problems are results of long-term accumulation, reflecting multi-layer internal conflicts embedded in the economy: not only systemic factors but also managerial factors, not only structural reasons arising from the transitions from the planning economy to the market economy but also imbalances generated from the financial system reforms; not only problems generated from transitions from closed economic system to the open economic system but also problems stemming from imbalances in the market economy; not only historical problems but also new problems generated from the excessive expansion of capital because of the soft budgeting. Due to the complexity, diversity and comprehensiveness, comprehensive measures and strategies must be taken against financial risks. Chapter Five systematically analyzes the transferring of the fiscal risks in China to the financial risk based on its elaborating of relations between fiscal risks and financial risks. Owing to defects of fiscal policy in China and mismatch of fiscal and monetary policies, it is a long period the state treasury has been leading to accumulation of financial risks by having financial institutions finance its expenditures by which fiscal risks were transferred. In other words, the transferring of fiscal risks to financial risks relies on the close relations between state treasury and financial institutions. The author argues that banks depend on the balance of fund flow-in and flow-out with a steady state. While the outcome of the transferring of fiscal risks to banks will be to utilize the fund of saving deposit, and then the assets of this utilization will mainly evolve risk assets of the banks. Such a transferring weakens banks’ liquidity and violates business order of banking sector, and brings about many of restructure, withdrawal and bankruptcy of financial institutions. Nevertheless the cost of dissolving the risks are much higher than one of leading to risks. Chapter Six comes up with ideas and methodologies to prevent and dissolve financial risks in China from the aspects of strategies, environments, macro & micro-economic policies. The author proves that both state treasury and financial institutions are fund providers, but different features of the funds from two channels define their range and mechanism and objects. Sometimes state treasury and financial institutions overlap their activities, but such a overlapping cannot change the basic features of non-compensation of fiscal fund or compensation of credit fund. So fiscal activities and financial activities shall abide each own rules and play proper roles in different areas. In practice, the most important task is currently to define the functions of state treasury and financial institutions and the relations of these two fund suppliers, and then to confine the activities of two sectors and the rules for special issues. Thus, to effectively prevent and dissolve financial risks during transitional period in China need not only flexibly coordinating fiscal and monetary policies, but also taking corresponding measures at the levels of macro µ economies. At the period when financial institutions adopt modern enterprise system and rules, supervisory institution shall adapt itself to the trend of mixing financial businesses and establish the financial supervision and administration system that suits China’s situations.

Title: The Comparative Study of the Socialism Development Values of Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping
Abstract: Development is the eternal theme of human society. Development viewpoint to about total viewpoint and basic viewpoint of social development , instruct people carry on cardinal principle of social work. Dialectical materialism think what kind of development viewpoint does it have , what kind of development paths does it have. If development one boat that brave the wind and the waves, develop viewpoint to is it sail the steersman in the direction to administer. Whether a society could establish the correct development viewpoint , concerns the development that this society could be healthy , lasting , overall. So, it is essential to development and progress of the human society to develop the viewpoint. The socialist cause is mankind's brand-new undertaking. Persons who are regarded as the initiator and development of China's socialist cause of Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping respectively, in exploring that there is course of the development path of socialism with chinese characteristics, form two have close connection , have obvious socialism of difference develop the viewpoint. No matter Mao Zedong, or Deng Xiaoping, socialism is development viewpoint have abundant content very. But Mao Zedong socialism development viewpoint Mao Zedong Thought , Deng Xiaoping socialism develop viewpoint no Deng Xiaoping Theory after all, socialism develops the viewpoint just about the cardinal principle of the social development, can't attend to each and every aspect of a matter . So this text has just chosen the development path and development model in term of developing the viewpoint, developing stage , developing several respects , such as motive force and central task , development goal and strategic plan ,etc., socialism of great man develop viewpoint carry on comparative analysis , is it find out the difference of the two and get in touch to aim at to two. Because of this, whole logic structure of this text and main content are formed by five parts: First, theory resource and history , era background analyse This part compare Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping socialist development theory origin and different history , era background that viewpoint produce to analyse mainly. In Marx, Engels , Lenin , Stalin, there then , is it describe about socialist development system of viewpoint to have, no more successful experience about socialist construction either. So, Mao Zedong, with Deng Xiaoping when explore the Chinese socialism development problem, theory resource and successful socialist construction experience that can utilize are quite limited. The national conditions that Mao Zedong and Deng Xiaoping face are " poor and underdeveloped ", have a large population, based on a weak economy. But the understanding of the national conditions is different. Mao Zedong regards " poor and underdeveloped " as the advantage , " easy to write with the newest and most beautiful characters, easy to draw the newest and most beautiful picture ", have ignored socialist arduousness of developing, mistake of making " left " to incline and advance rashly in socialism is developed. Deng Xiaoping see " have a large population , based on a weak economy " unfavorable one side , is it develop socialist long period of time and arduousness to put emphasis on more, pay attention to doing solid work , looking for the truth and be practical further in developing. Era that Mao Zedong face theme" war and revolution ", excessive to estimate that erupts the danger of the world war, have influenced the decision to the development strategy of Mao Zedong. Deng Xiaoping has held theme " peace and development " of the era at that time correctly, pay attention to developing further, safeguard the peace. Mao Zedong Times, the mainstream of the international communist movement is that eager to carry out the transition to communism producing the wind altogether prevails, Mao Zedong's " catching up with and surpassing strategy " is influenced by this and put forward. In Deng Xiaoping times, the reform is a mainstream of the international communist movement at that time, so, Deng Xiaoping regards reform and opening-up as the only way of China's social doctrine development. Second, about the development path and socialist development model This part of is analysis mainly compare Mao Zedong and the development road of the option of Deng Xiaoping and their two differences develop pattern. found country initial stage, China is basically in building have copied Soviet pattern. along with Soviet pattern abuse expose , Mao Zedong have put forward " is warning with the Soviet Union, " " go to own road, " thought, begin explore accord with the socialist development road of Chinese reality more, try hard breakthrough Soviet pattern. but because of Mao Zedong " is left , " incline the influence of thought, do not break through the planned pattern of economic system of high concentration eventually. Deng Xiaoping in summarize historical experience give the socialist road of Chinese characteristic a lesson foundation on, have put forward go have , have established the system of socialist market economy develop pattern, make the socialist construction of China have gone to the orbit of healthy development. Third, about developing stage of socialism This part of is analysis mainly compare Mao Zedong " two stage theory " with the socialist elementary stage theory of Deng Xiaoping content. Mao Zedong have put forward : socialism may divide into " not developed socialism " and " more developed socialism " two stages, our country is still in " not developed socialism " stage. reforming and opening up to the outside world after, Deng Xiaoping have gone on for the socialist located stage of our country know again, have put forward the theory of socialist elementary stage, have established " a central, two basic points " socialist elementary stage basic route. Fourth, about develop motive force and central task of socialism In socialism develop power aspect, Mao Zedong have put forward " basic contradictory power theory ", point out the contradiction between production relation and productivity, superstructure and the contradiction between economic foundation is still the basic contradiction of socialist society, is promote socialist basic power. discuss according to basic contradictory power, have put forward the basic task of socialist society is " protect and develop productivity, ". Deng Xiaoping in 11 classes of 3 in plenary after, have put forward " reform power theory ", in reform production relation and superstructure the basic task of socialism and the abuse of obstruction productivity development is " liberate and develop productivity ", reform is 2th Chinese revolutionary. Fifth, about the socialist development goal and strategic plan In socialism develop goal aspect, Mao Zedong have put forward realization 4 modern goals, realize industry, agriculture, defence and the modernization of science and technology . for realize this magnificent goal, Mao Zedong have again established " two steps goes " strategic deployment. Deng Xiaoping inherit and develop the thought of the 4 modern goals of Mao Zedong , have put forward " become the construction of our country , is prosperous, democratic , civilized socialist modern country " goal. for realize this goal, Deng Xiaoping put forward " three steps goes " strategic deployment. Deng Xiaoping develop goal and strategic deployment than strategic deployment and the goal of Mao Zedong more specific , more reality , more practical feasible.
